com.github.sarxos.webcam

Class WebcamPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.github.sarxos.webcam.WebcamPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WebcamListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, PropertyChangeListener, Serializable, EventListener, Accessible

    public class WebcamPanel
extends JPanel
implements WebcamListener, PropertyChangeListener
    Simply implementation of JPanel allowing users to render pictures taken with webcam.
    Author:
    Bartosz Firyn (SarXos)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Interface of the painter used to draw image in panel.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebcamPanel

        public WebcamPanel(Webcam webcam)
        Creates webcam panel and automatically start webcam.
        Parameters:
        webcam - the webcam to be used to fetch images

      • WebcamPanel

        public WebcamPanel(Webcam webcam,
                   boolean start)
        Creates new webcam panel which display image from camera in you your Swing application.
        Parameters:
        webcam - the webcam to be used to fetch images
        start - true if webcam shall be automatically started

      • WebcamPanel

        public WebcamPanel(Webcam webcam,
                   Dimension size,
                   boolean start)
        Creates new webcam panel which display image from camera in you your Swing application. If panel size argument is null, then image size will be used. If you would like to fill panel area with image even if its size is different, then you can use setFillArea(boolean) method to configure this.
        Parameters:
        webcam - the webcam to be used to fetch images
        size - the size of panel
        start - true if webcam shall be automatically started
        See Also:
        setFillArea(boolean)

      • isFPSLimited

        public boolean isFPSLimited()
        Is frequency limit enabled?
        Returns:
        True or false

      • setFPSLimited

        public void setFPSLimited(boolean frequencyLimit)
        Enable or disable frequency limit. Frequency limit should be used for all IP cameras working in pull mode (to save number of HTTP requests). If true, images will be fetched in configured time intervals. If false, images will be fetched as fast as camera can serve them.
        Parameters:
        frequencyLimit -

      • getFPSLimit

        public double getFPSLimit()
        Get rendering frequency in FPS (equivalent to Hz).
        Returns:
        Rendering frequency

      • setFPSLimit

        public void setFPSLimit(double fps)
        Set rendering frequency (in Hz or FPS). Minimum frequency is 0.016 (1 frame per minute) and maximum is 25 (25 frames per second).
        Parameters:
        fps - the frequency

      • isDisplayDebugInfo

        public boolean isDisplayDebugInfo()
        Is displaying of some debug information enabled.
        Returns:
        True if debug information are enabled, false otherwise

      • setDisplayDebugInfo

        public void setDisplayDebugInfo(boolean displayDebugInfo)
        Display some debug information on image surface.
        Parameters:
        displayDebugInfo - the value to control debug information

      • isFPSDisplayed

        public boolean isFPSDisplayed()
        This method return true in case if camera FPS is set to be displayed on panel surface. Default value returned is false.
        Returns:
        True if camera FPS is set to be displayed on panel surface
        See Also:
        setFPSDisplayed(boolean)

      • setFPSDisplayed

        public void setFPSDisplayed(boolean displayed)
        This method is to control if camera FPS should be displayed on the webcam panel surface.
        Parameters:
        displayed - the value to control if camera FPS should be displayed

      • isImageSizeDisplayed

        public boolean isImageSizeDisplayed()
        This method will return true in case when panel is configured to display image size. The string will be printed in the right bottom corner of the panel surface.
        Returns:
        True in case if panel is configured to display image size

      • setImageSizeDisplayed

        Configure panel to display camera image size to be displayed.
        Parameters:
        imageSizeDisplayed -

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isFitArea

        public boolean isFitArea()

      • setFitArea

        public void setFitArea(boolean fitArea)
        This method will change the mode of panel area painting so the image will be resized and will keep scale factor to fit into drawable panel bounds. When set to false, the mode will be reset to WebcamPanel.DrawMode.NONE so image will be drawn as it is.
        Parameters:
        fitArea - the fit area mode enabled or disabled

      • setFillArea

        public void setFillArea(boolean fillArea)
        Image will be resized to fill panel area if true. If false then image will be rendered as it was obtained from webcam instance.
        Parameters:
        fillArea - shall image be resided to fill panel area

      • isFillArea

        public boolean isFillArea()
        Get value of fill area setting. Image will be resized to fill panel area if true. If false then image will be rendered as it was obtained from webcam instance.
        Returns:
        True if image is being resized, false otherwise

      • getDefaultPainter

        public WebcamPanel.Painter getDefaultPainter()
        Get default painter used to draw panel.
        Returns:
        Default painter

      • isMirrored

        public boolean isMirrored()
        This method returns true if image mirroring is enabled. The default value is false.
        Returns:
        True if image is mirrored, false otherwise

      • setMirrored

        public void setMirrored(boolean mirrored)
        Decide whether or not the image from webcam painted on panel surface will be mirrored. The image from camera itself is not modified.
        Parameters:
        mirrored - the parameter to control if image should be mirrored
